list.bio: Dr. Marla Ferschl is a pediatric anesthesiologist who treats children requiring sedation or anesthesia for procedures, radiologic studies or surgery. She has a special research interest in preoperative evaluations and quality assurance.

list.name: Jennifer Lucero, M.D.
title: Assistant Professor of Pediatrics
Anesthesia/Perioperative Care
Obstetrics, Gynecology and Reproductive Sciences
list.bio:
Dr. Jennifer Lucero is a physician-scientist who received her medical degree at Yale School of Medicine and then completed training in both Obstetrics/Gynecology and Anesthesia at UCSF. After her anesthesia training, she spent two years completing both an obstetric anesthesia and NIH research fellowship.
She is both a member of the Obstetric Anesthesia and Fetal Anesthesia team and is actively investigating the maternal end-organ effects of preeclampsia. Given Dr. Lucero's training she has been involved in fetal surgeries and management as both an obstetrician and anesthesiologist.

list.title: Nurses
list.intro:
The Fetal Treatment Center's nurse coordinator is integral to your experience at UCSF. She will coordinate your care, beginning with communication with your health care provider. She will coordinate your various appointments with sonography, echocardiology, laboratory testing, and arrange consultations with medical team members. You should feel free to contact our coordinator at any time before surgery or after you leave if you have any concerns.
Our OB nurses will provide you with expert care throughout your stay. They will help you recover from surgery, provide pain relief, help to monitor your uterus, and oversee the fetus’s well-being.
Our OR nurses assist the surgeons in the operating room and also may be available to you before surgery to answer any questions you have about the procedure itself. You will see them briefly when you arrive in the operating room the day of the surgery. Our operating room nurse clinical specialist is Cassandra Robertson.

list.name: Jody A. Farrell, RN, MS, PNP
title: Director, Fetal Treatment Center
list.bio:
Ms. Farrell is a Clinical Nurse V for the Department of Surgery, Division of Pediatric Surgery at the University of California San Francisco. She is currently the Director of the Fetal Treatment Center. The Fetal Treatment Center receives hundreds of referrals annually. Ms. Farrell utilizes her many years of neonatal experience to provide referring physicians and patients with information on the etiology, pathophysiology and the evaluation process of fetuses with congenital anomalies.
When a referral is made to the Fetal Treatment Center, Ms. Farrell obtains the history from the referring physician and has the obstetrical history and ultrasound sent to UCSF. The following week the patient is then presented before the Fetal Treatment Center Team. At that time recommendations are forwarded to the patient and the referring physician.
In addition to her clinical responsibilities, Ms. Farrell also maintains the database on all patient referrals. These statistics assist both the surgeons and postdoctoral research fellows with their publications. Most importantly, they provide information to both change and refine the current surgical procedures now performed at the Fetal Treatment Center.
Ms. Farrell has been a registered nurse at UCSF since 1979. Prior to her work at the Fetal Treatment Center in 1994, she held various positions in the Neonatal Intensive Care Nursery at UCSF. She was a staff nurse for ten years and a member of the Neonatal/Pediatric Transport Team. From 1991-1994, Mrs. Farrell was the Coordinator of the Neonatal/Pediatric ECMO Program.
Ms. Farrell received her undergraduate degree from the University of California San Francisco. She has completed her studies for an Advanced Practice Pediatric Nurse Practitioner masters degree from UCSF. Mrs. Farrell is a native San Franciscan.
She lives on the San Francisco peninsula with her husband and three children.

list.name: Leanne Duong, NP
title: Nurse Practitioner
Fetal Heart Center
list.bio: Ms. Duong, a native of the Bay Area, joined the Fetal Heart Center in 2015.  She spent the last 13 years as a nurse in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit at UCLA. She is a graduate of UCSF, where she earned her MS in Acute Care Pediatrics and Nurse Practitioner license. Her focus on becoming an Acute Care Pediatric Nurse Practitioner was to develop an expertise in the clinical management of acutely and critically ill infants, children and adolescents with congenital heart disease.

list.name: Ayanna Fritton, RN
title: Clinical Coordinator
Fetal Treatment Center
list.bio: Ms. Fritton joined the Fetal Treatment Center in 2016. She spent the last 14 years as a nurse in the Intensive Care Nursery. The majority of her career has been in the UCSF Intensive Care Nursery, aside from 4 years that she worked as a traveling nurse in several Neonatal Intensive Care Units across the country. Ayanna has a wide range of experience in caring for many types of babies from the smallest preterm infants to babies born with defects that may also require surgery.

list.name: Kristen Gosnell, RN, MS
title: Clinical Coordinator
Fetal Treatment Center
list.bio:
Ms. Gosnell is a Clinical Nurse Specialist at the UCSF Fetal Treatment Center. She completed her bachelor’s degree at Purdue University in 1997. Shortly after graduation she began her pediatric nursing career at Children’s Memorial Hospital in Chicago. Travel nursing brought her to San Francisco in 2003 where she worked as a RN in the Pediatric Intensive Care Unit. After finishing her Master’s degree at UCSF she began as a clinical coordinator for the division of pediatric surgery.
Ms. Gosnell’s clinical experience has been exclusively devoted to the care of children with acute and chronic illness. She expanded her skills to include the care of mothers and unborn infants when joining the Fetal Treatment Center Team in 2009. She specializes in pregnancies complicated by congenital heart disease and twin to twin transfusion syndrome. Her research interests include long-term neurodevelopmental outcomes in complicated twin pregnancies and in-utero treatment of urological disease. In addition to her work in the fetal center, Ms. Gosnell enjoys teaching nursing students. She shares her knowledge and skills as adjunct clinical faculty in schools across the Bay Area.

list.name: Rachel Perry, RN
title: Clinical Coordinator
Fetal Treatment Center
list.bio: Ms. Perry is a Clinical Nurse Coordinator at the UCSF Fetal Treatment Center. After receiving her nursing degree in 2004 she began her career in the Intensive Care Nursery at UCSF. She gained expertise in caring for both preterm babies and babies born with birth defects. In 2007 Rachel joined the Fetal Treatment Center as the nurse coordinator and specializes in pregnancies complicated by spina bifida.

list.name: Tamara Ryan, RN
title: Clinical Coordinator
Fetal Treatment Center
Pediatric Surgery
list.bio:
Ms. Ryan, a native Californian, grew up in the Midwest and received her nursing degree at the Columbus Technical Institute in Ohio in 1984 before returning to California. She has been a registered nurse for 19 years, specializing in ICU, CCU, education, and research. She has worked for UCSF since 1989 primarily as a clinical coordinator for several clinical trials. She has a passion for research and enjoys working closely with families.
Ms. Ryan joined the Fetal Treatment Center and Division of Pediatric Surgery as the Clinical Coordinator for Management of Myelomeningocele Study (MOMS).
Ms. Ryan lives with her husband and 5 children on the peninsula. She enjoys horseback riding, skiing, hiking, photography, cooking, and being a sailing and soccer mom.

list.name: Janice Scudmore, MSN, FNP
title: Nurse Practitioner
Fetal Treatment Center
list.bio: Ms. Scudmore joined the Fetal Treatment Center team after 8 years of OB/GYN private practice in San Francisco as a Nurse Practitioner. As a Registered Nurse she worked in Adult Transitional Intensive Care Units. The Fetal Team is enhanced by her knowledge of Obstetrics and Adult Intensive Care experience. Janice is from San Francisco. She is a Graduate of San Francisco State University, where she received her MSN and Nurse Practitioner license. Her Undergraduate RN was completed at Dominican University in San Rafael, CA.

list.title: Social Workers
list.intro: A UCSF social worker is available to you throughout you and your baby's stay. Our social worker can help you identify ways to cope with the stress of the situation. She or he will also tour you around the intensive care nursery and other facilities, and help you prepare for what to expect after the baby is born. She can also assist you with lodging arrangements and financial or insurance questions you may have.

list.name: Courtney Tong, LCSW
title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker
Fetal Treatment Center
list.bio:
Courtney Tong is a social worker in the Fetal Treatment Center of UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital where she counsels families who face complex pregnancies or whose babies require intensive care after birth. She arranges consultations for parents to meet with a neonatologist to discuss the care newborns may receive and conducts private tours of Labor & Delivery and the Intensive Care Nursery.
Ms. Tong earned a master's degree in social work at University of Washington with an emphasis in Health/Mental Health.  She started her social work career as the Burn Center Social Worker and Lead Pediatric Social Worker at Harborview Medical Center in Seattle, Washington.  In 2001, Ms. Tong returned to San Francisco (where she was born and raised) and started working at UCSF Children’s Hospital providing coverage to the Neuro-Surgery, Neuro-Oncology, Neurology services and the Spina Bifida Clinic as well as providing weekend and on-call coverage to the entire Children’s Hospital.  She joined the LIFE Clinic in March 2014 and the Fetal Treatment Center in April 2015.
